metadata.sermon_title: Christ vs. Adam: Kosovo and Beyond
metadata.notes: Preached shortly after the Kosovo War (1999) in an affluent Connecticut parish.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. The preacher avoids moralistic 'musts' and instead uses the Critical Parent position to deconstruct self-righteousness itself.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The CP is directed at the 'self-righteous religious person' rather than the listener's failures. It is a 'Parent against the Parent' move.
quotes: There is nothing as unbearable as a self-righteous religious person.
We relish every opportunity to cluck our tongues... giving not a thought to our own.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. The preacher offers comfort through the 'Free Gift' but maintains the gravity of the human situation.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: The care is supportive of the listener's struggle with internal 'civil war,' promoting a sense of shared humanity rather than dependency.
quotes: I hope with all my heart that you hear this announcement today as the electrifying, world-transforming news that it is.

adult.score_explanation: 10 = Strong Adult presence. The preacher uses historical data, psychological theory (Freud), and current events to process reality.
adult.analysis: The listener is treated as an intellectual peer. The preacher uses the Adult to dismantle the 'Gimmick' of American optimism (freedom of the will) by providing evidence of systemic and psychological bondage.
quotes: What we see illustrated here is that victims can become victimizers in a blink.
The American answer to every theological and ethical dilemma is 'freedom of the will.'

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. The preacher does not use fear of hell or social shame to force compliance.
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The sermon explicitly rejects the 'clucking tongues' of the Adapted Child/Critical Parent social dynamic.
quotes: Self-righteous religiosity separates the spiritual from the unspiritual in a way that Paul says is the opposite of the gospel.

free_child_FC.score_explanation: 10 = Authentic, playful, joyful. While the subject is grim, there is an authentic 'Free Child' joy in the proclamation of grace.
free_child_FC.analysis: The joy is not 'playful' but 'liberated,' emerging from the relief of being 'acquitted.'
quotes: Now I just need a job.

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher consistently invites the listener into an Adult state by asking 'What would you and I do?' and analyzing the 'human condition' as a shared data set.
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: Minimal. The preacher is transparent about the 'trap' of self-righteousness.
transaction_analysis.purity_explanation: 10 = Completely transparent. The sermon is remarkably free of the 'double bottom' common in religious rhetoric.
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The only risk is the 'Bait' of the idyllic setting (Middle Cove) being used to contrast the 'Gimmick' of global suffering, but this is used for Adult reflection rather than a guilt-trip.

detected_games.name: None / Anti-Game

formula_g_analysis.con: The preacher avoids the 'Con' of simple moral improvement.
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: He identifies the listener's weak spot (self-righteousness) but instead of using it to control them, he uses it to level the playing field.
formula_g_analysis.switch: No switch from Rescuer to Persecutor occurs.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The payoff is 'Life' and 'Acquittal' rather than the 'Bad Feeling' of a game.

evidence_quotes: All of us are part of the human mob.
Christ died for the ungodly... the victims and the victimizers.

games_analysis.absence_of_games_analysis: The preacher actively blocks the game 'Holier Than Thou' by including himself in the 'Adam' category and identifying his own potential for violence.

preacher_roles.rescuer: Low. He points to Christ as the only Rescuer, refusing the role himself.
preacher_roles.persecutor: Low. He critiques 'self-righteousness' but does not persecute the individual.
preacher_roles.victim: Low. He identifies as part of the 'captive' human race but avoids self-pity.

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: The congregation is invited to step out of the 'Victim' role (captive to sin) into 'Autonomy' (reigning in life).
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: The sermon offers an escape through the 'Free Gift,' which breaks the cycle of the Triangle by providing 'acquittal' that isn't earned.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: This sermon is a rare example of psychologically healthy homiletics. It utilizes a strong Adult ego position to bypass the typical Parent-Child power dynamics of the pulpit. By identifying the 'Drama Triangle' inherent in the Kosovo conflict (victims becoming victimizers), the preacher warns the congregation against the same pattern. He avoids the 'I'm Only Trying To Help You' game by admitting his own powerlessness under the 'law of sin.' The result is an invitation to authentic autonomy based on the 'Free Gift' rather than coercive moralism.
strengths: Inclusion of the preacher in the 'Adam' (dysfunctional) state.
areas_for_improvement: The transition to the 'Free Child' (joy) at the end is slightly brief compared to the heavy Adult analysis of the 'Adam' state.
Risk of the 'Ain't It Awful' game when discussing global violence, though mitigated by the call to personal responsibility.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Continue to use the 'We' pronoun to maintain the Adult-Adult level. Ensure the 'Free Gift' is presented as an empowerment of the Free Child rather than a new set of rules for the Adapted Child.
